values: I read over a lot of these old entries, and it's funny how much I haven't changed. At the same time, I've changed a lot. It was interesting to read my own words that I didn't remember, and to be reminded of things that happened to me that I've long since forgotten. There are entries where I mentioned things that were trivial at the time, but have become so important to me now...and vice versa: I stressed over things that were significant to me then, but are now distant memories. Also, there are entries in which I anticipated events that are now fond memories. I'm an eloquent writer...or, I was back on '06. Maybe I'll use this for poetry now. Maybe not, I'm not sure.

Sometimes I really detest caring for other people. I don't mean this in an emo, hinting at "oh i am bitter and upset about something" sort of way. I just think that I would be a much freer spirit if I could be completely sociopathic and not care for others at all. I'm halfway there. It's weird because the more I want to be shallow, the easier it is to be increasingly shallow. You'd think that's impossible, but it isn't. To just become more self-centered and less affected by others, and by what goes on around you. I'm living it! I've even started to strongly dislike animals and children. And anyone or anything else that isn't of use or beneficial to me. Sound shallow to you?

The fact is, obviously, I DO truly care about a choice few. Of course I do. But it just makes me so worried that I'll be disappointed or hurt or let down or betrayed or something, anything at all. So I usually distance myself from those people as much as I can. Honestly. 
I do like to have fun with people for short periods of time, if I'm in the right mood. I'll be the most social little lady you ever did see--as long as I don't actually have to form and maintain a bond of any sort with anyone. Too much work to maintain the few I already have. I don't like trying to meet people's expectations, so I try to be nearly a stranger to everyone, so that they don't really have any solid expectations of me at all. Then I'm homefree. 
I like for people to think that they know me really well and to believe that we're close, and know deep down that they don't actually know a goddamn thing about me. I feel really safe and preserved that way. And I am temporarily entertained at the same time.

So anyway....let's be best friends.

You piss me off or hurt my feelings --> You find yourself eating my dust soon thereafter. Actually, I don't even intend upon leaving any dust behind. So you can eat memories. I don't feel sorry and I don't look back. At 15, I disowned an entire side of my family.
Someday those tendencies of mine will catch up to me, but for now, when I'm still a vulnerable, young soul, it works for me. I don't need anybody's shit! Haha. Random tangent, there.

I am sick with a nasty, killer cold. Sore throat, coughing--voice all messed up, yucky nose, body aches, fatigue, etc. It's sort of sucky. I left school after 2nd period today. and slept deeply and solidly from 10am to 2:30pm, haha. I worked a TON this weekend, and barely slept or ate, like the idiot I am. Which is why I am so easily infected with disease, haha.
I've got 10 absences in U.S. History and 9 in most of my other classes. For some reason, French got lucky and I've only missed 7 classes in there, lol. I'm ridiculous, I know. I just want Junior year to BE OVER AND DONE WITH! SO badly. 
Finals are gonna be pretty damn challenging but I'm still psyched because finals week rocks. 
My computer is being overtaken by a virus, sent to me via IM when I had let my guard down, lol. I was so innocent! 
I don't mean to sound whiney in this entry. I'm in good spirits.

For anyone wondering, the rumors are true. I am indeed dating a 23 year old. It sounds bad and I am aware of that, which is why I don't go around telling folks left and right because they may just assume the worst. But he's great, and I've decided that I just don't care much about what people might think. Anyone who knows me knows that it's alright. We get along well and have fun. We care about each other a lot. He makes me happy. (: I'm not a dirty fool, so nobody needs to worry for me! But I understand a person's concern. Yes, my parents know, and they are cool with it. Like I said, I'm not a fool, and I wouldn't date a guy behind my parents' backs because that's just lame and shitty.

So tomorrow will pretty much determine my US History semester grade. My group has to go present a shitload of stuff way out in Milton, NH. Wish us luck! ::bites nails:: We have to do a ton of work tonight in preparation. It should be interesting, haha. Speaking of which, I've gotta go take some cold medicine and head on over to Dan's house for our project stuff. 

Have a great week, everyone. Just a handful of days left to go before Summertime hits!!
